definition: surname Mi/name of an ancient state

sentences.english: My secret communion with God is the place where I learn the great lessons concerning God's will.
sentences.chinese: 在與神相交的隱密處，我學到有關神旨意的偉大功課。

sentences.english: In short, they find their work interesting.
sentences.chinese: 簡言之，隱密直似有接受祕事之權也。

sentences.english: I hid my money in a secret place.
sentences.chinese: 我把錢藏在一處隱密的地方。

sentences.english: Hast thou entered into the springs of the sea? or hast thou walked in the search of the depth?
sentences.chinese: 你曾進到海源，或在深淵的隱密處行走嗎。

sentences.english: Have you journeyed to the springs of the sea or walked in the recesses of the deep?
sentences.chinese: 你曾進到海源，或在深淵的隱密處行走嗎？

sentences.english: It's like having a secret stash of ice cream in the freezer.
sentences.chinese: 這就像在冰箱裏有個隱密的隔層放着冰淇淋。

sentences.english: Hide them in the dust together; and bind their faces in secret.
sentences.chinese: 將他們一同隱藏在塵土中，把他們的臉矇蔽在隱密處。

sentences.english: The progress of the grooming can be quick and insidious.
sentences.chinese: 案件發展的進程可能很快和隱密。

sentences.english: Keep a Secret Space for Yourself.
sentences.chinese: 給自己保留一個隱密空間。

sentences.english: He lieth under the shady trees, in the covert of the reed, and fens.
sentences.chinese: 牠伏在蓮葉之下，臥在蘆葦隱密處和水窪子裏。

sentences.english: My hidden prayer life is inseparably bound up with united prayer.
sentences.chinese: 公衆聯合的禱告，不能缺少隱密處的禱告生活而存在。

sentences.english: He who dwells in the shelter of the Most High will rest in the shadow of the Almighty.
sentences.chinese: 住在至高者隱密處的，必住在全能者的蔭下。

sentences.english: Trials - Sneak through the underground passage without tearing your scarf.
sentences.chinese: 圍巾未損壞下隱密地通過地下通道。

sentences.english: The building structure insures privacy and quietude.
sentences.chinese: 那建築物的結構保證具有隱密性和寧靜。

definition: to hide/to conceal/to mask/to shelter/to harbor (i.e. keep sth hidden)/to hide oneself/to lie low/to nestle/hidden/implicit/private/covert/recessed (lighting)
to pry into or spy on/to snoop/to peep/to poke one's nose into/to peer/to get a glimpse of
exterior appearance/to view sth from the outside/exterior condition
(saying) to be very scared and on edge
